definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: The Punks ' subculture started in the mid 70s.
sentences.chinese: 庞克的次文化是从70年代中期开始的。

sentences.english: The punk movement is one of the most successful movements in history.
sentences.chinese: 庞克运动是历史上最成功的运动之一。

sentences.english: This is a punk rock song.
sentences.chinese: 这是一首庞克摇滚歌曲。

sentences.english: That song was the old Grand Funk Railroad hit 'Locomotion'.
sentences.chinese: 这是一首老格兰德庞克铁路流行歌“火车头”。
猴子庞克是我们的国王。

sentences.english: The punk scene we came out of and the punk scene now are completely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们当时的庞克景象和当今已经完全不同了。

sentences.english: From its beginnings, in the wake of punk - rock, U2 made music on a grand scale .
sentences.chinese: 在庞克摇滚后成军的U2，制作音乐的格局很大。

definition: Clark T. Randt Jr. (1945-), US ambassador to Beijing 2001-2009
Hofmann or Hoffman (name)/August Wilhelm von Hofmann (1818-1892), German chemist/Dustin Hoffman (1937-), US film actor
phonetic fei or fi/elegant/phi (Greek letter Φ, φ)
